newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Euroairport cargo traffic up 14 percent Jan-Sept.
newsitem.headline: Euroairport cargo traffic up 14 percent Jan-Sept.

text.p: Total cargo traffic handled at Basle-Mulhouse-Freiburg airport on the French-Swiss border in the first nine months of 1996, totalled 65,239 tonnes or up 14 percent on the same period last year, airport authority figures show.
January-September 1996 airfreight traffic handled at the airport, officially known as EuroAirport, totalled 36,154 tonnes, an increase of 29 percent on 1995 levels.
Airfreight carried on scheduled full-freighter services increased by 45 percent to 23,490 tonnes, the airport authority added.
In the past 18 months, full-freighter services have been launched from EuroAirport to Chicago, Atlanta, Delhi, Seoul and Istanbul.
Last month, Swissair launched a weekly McDonnell Douglas DC10-30 freighter service between EuroAirport and Sao Paulo.
Express airfreight rose by five percent on 1995 levels to 9,321 tonnes.
Trucked airfreight traffic was down one percent on last year's levels at 29,085 tonnes.
Postal traffic totalled 2,493 tonnes, up eight percent on the first nine months of 1995. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
